Clerkenwell Crime Syndicate

The Clerkenwell crime syndicate, also known as the Adams crime family, is a British organized crime syndicate that was active in the mid-20th century to the early 21st century. The gang was known for its involvement in various forms of organized crime, including extortion, loan sharking, and armed robbery. The syndicate was based in the Clerkenwell area of London and was led by the Adams family, who were of Irish and English descent.

#Background

The Clerkenwell crime syndicate emerged in the 1960s, during a period of significant social and economic change in the United Kingdom. The gang's origins are closely tied to the Adams family, who had a long history of involvement in organized crime. The family's patriarch, Patrick Adams, was a notorious gangster who had been involved in various forms of crime, including armed robbery and extortion.

In the 1960s, Patrick's sons, Terry, Tommy, and Patsy, began to take a more active role in the family's criminal activities. The brothers were known for their ruthless tactics and their ability to build a network of associates and allies that stretched across London.

article:
Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (film)
==========================

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 is a 2022 American live-action/animated comedy-adventure film directed by Jeff Fowler and written by Pat Casey, Josh Miller, and John Whittington. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film Sonic the Hedgehog and is based on the video game franchise of the same name by Sega. The film stars Ben Schwartz, James Marsden, Tika Sumpter, Natasha Rothwell, Adam Pally, Shemar Moore, Idris Elba, and Jim Carrey.

Plot
-----

The film takes place after the events of the first film, with Sonic (Ben Schwartz) now living with Tom Wachowski (James Marsden) and Maddie (Tika Sumpter) in Green Hills. However, Sonic's new life is disrupted by the arrival of Dr. Robotnik (Jim Carrey), who has returned to Earth with a new ally, Knuckles the Echidna (Idris Elba). Knuckles is on a mission to find the Master Emerald, a powerful artifact that can grant immense power.

As Sonic and his friends try to stop Dr. Robotnik and Knuckles, they are also joined by a new ally, Tails (Colleen O'Shaughnessey), a two-tailed fox who is a skilled mechanic and pilot. Together, they embark on a thrilling adventure to stop Dr. Robotnik's evil plans and save the world.

Cast
-----

### Voice cast

* Ben Schwartz as Sonic the Hedgehog
* Colleen O'Shaughnessey as Miles "Tails" Prower
* Idris Elba as Knuckles the Echidna

### Live-action cast

* James Marsden as Tom Wachowski
* Tika Sumpter as Maddie Wachowski
* Natasha Rothwell as Rachel
* Adam Pally as Wade
* Shemar Moore as Randall
* Jim Carrey as Dr. Robotnik

Production
------------

### Development

In May 2020, Paramount Pictures and Sega announced that a sequel to the first film was in development, with Jeff Fowler set to return as director. Pat Casey and Josh Miller were hired to write the screenplay, with John Whittington also contributing to the story. The film was greenlit in July 2020, with production set to begin in March 2021.

### Casting

In January 2021, it was announced that Idris Elba would be joining the cast as Knuckles the Echidna. In February 2021, it was confirmed that Ben Schwartz would be reprising his role as Sonic, with James Marsden, Tika Sumpter, Natasha Rothwell, and Adam Pally also set to return. Colleen O'Shaughnessey was cast as Tails in April 2021.

### Filming, visual effects, and animation

Principal photography began on March 15, 2021, in Vancouver, British Columbia, and wrapped on May 25, 2021. Visual effects were handled by Moving Picture Company, with animation provided by MPC and Marza Animation Planet. The film's action sequences were choreographed by stunt coordinator, Andy Cheng.

### Music

The film's score was composed by Tom Holkenborg, with a mix of rock and electronic music. The soundtrack features several classic rock songs, including "I Need a Hero" by Bonnie Tyler and "Live and Let Die" by Paul McCartney.

Release
-------

### Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in December 2021, with a teaser trailer released on December 10, 2021. A full trailer was released on March 14, 2022, with a final trailer released on April 1, 2022. The film's promotional partners included Burger King, Doritos, and Subway.

### Theatrical

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 was released in the United States on April 8, 2022, in IMAX, Dolby Cinema, and RealD 3D formats. The film was released in the United Kingdom on April 1, 2022, and in Australia on March 31, 2022.

### Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on May 24, 2022, with a physical release on Blu-ray and DVD on August 9, 2022.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 grossed $405.4 million worldwide on a budget of $110 million, making it a commercial success. The film grossed $162.7 million in the United States and $242.7 million internationally.

### Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with praise for its action sequences, visual effects, and performances. The film holds a 69% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 6.2/10.

### Accolades

The film was nominated for several awards, including a Teen Choice Award for Choice Movie: Action and a People's Choice Award for Favorite Family Movie.

Sequel
-------

In April 2022, it was announced that a third film in the Sonic franchise was in development, with Jeff Fowler set to return as director. The film is expected to be released in 2024.

See also
--------

* Sonic the Hedgehog (2020 film)
* Sonic the Hedgehog (video game series)

2023–24 UEFA Europa Conference League qualifying phase and play-off round (Main Path)

The 2023–24 UEFA Europa Conference League qualifying phase and play-off round (Main Path) will begin on 12 July 2023 and end on 31 August 2023. A total of 154 teams will compete in the qualifying phase and play-off round to decide 22 of the 32 places in the group stage of the 2023–24 UEFA Europa Conference League.

# First qualifying round

## Summary

The draw for the first qualifying round was held on 20 June 2023. The first legs will be played on 12 and 13 July 2023, and the second legs will be played on 18 and 20 July 2023. A total of 62 teams will compete in the first qualifying round.

## Matches

The matches will be played in a two-legged format, with the first leg at the home stadium of the team that is drawn first. The team with the higher aggregate score at the end of the second leg will advance to the next round.

# Second qualifying round

## Summary

The draw for the second qualifying round will be held on 21 June 2023. The first legs will be played on 25 and 26 July 2023, and the second legs will be played on 31 July and 1 August 2023. A total of 106 teams will compete in the second qualifying round, including the 31 winners of the first qualifying round.

## Matches

The matches will be played in a two-legged format, with the first leg at the home stadium of the team that is drawn first. The team with the higher aggregate score at the end of the second leg will advance to the next round.

# Third qualifying round

## Summary

The draw for the third qualifying round will be held on 24 July 2023. The first legs will be played on 8 and 9 August 2023, and the second legs will be played on 15 and 16 August 2023. A total of 64 teams will compete in the third qualifying round, including the 53 winners of the second qualifying round.

## Matches

The matches will be played in a two-legged format, with the first leg at the home stadium of the team that is drawn first. The team with the higher aggregate score at the end of the second leg will advance to the next round.

# Play-off round

## Summary

The draw for the play-off round will be held on 7 August 2023. The first legs will be played on 22 and 23 August 2023, and the second legs will be played on 29 and 30 August 2023. A total of 44 teams will compete in the play-off round, including the 32 winners of the third qualifying round.

## Matches

The matches will be played in a two-legged format, with the first leg at the home stadium of the team that is drawn first. The team with the higher aggregate score at the end of the second leg will advance to the group stage of the 2023–24 UEFA Europa Conference League.

# Notes

* Teams that lose in the qualifying phase and play-off round will be eliminated from the competition.
* Teams that win in the play-off round will advance to the group stage of the 2023–24 UEFA Europa Conference League.

article:
2023 Ukrainian Counteroffensive

The 2023 Ukrainian counteroffensive is a major military operation launched by the Ukrainian Armed Forces in June 2023, aimed at reclaiming territories occupied by Russian forces since the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. The counteroffensive is a significant turning point in the conflict, marking a shift in momentum in favor of Ukraine.

# Background

## State of the war

As of early 2023, the war in Ukraine had reached a stalemate, with both sides dug in along a 1,000 km front line. Russian forces had made significant gains in the Donbas region, but Ukrainian forces had managed to hold off further advances. The war had also taken a devastating toll on civilians, with thousands killed or displaced.

## Russian defenses

Russian forces had established a complex network of defenses, including trenches, minefields, and fortifications. They had also deployed significant artillery and air defense assets to support their ground troops. However, the Russian military had also suffered significant losses, and morale was reportedly low.

# Prelude

## Planning

Ukrainian military planners had been preparing for a counteroffensive for months, studying Russian defenses and identifying vulnerabilities. They had also received significant support from Western countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and other NATO members.

## Shaping operations

In the weeks leading up to the counteroffensive, Ukrainian forces launched a series of shaping operations, aimed at weakening Russian defenses and creating opportunities for a breakthrough. These operations included artillery strikes, drone attacks, and sabotage missions.

# Counteroffensive

## Start date

The Ukrainian counteroffensive began on June 4, 2023, with a series of coordinated attacks along the front line.

## Southern front

### Melitopol direction

Ukrainian forces launched a major attack in the Melitopol direction, aiming to retake the city of Melitopol and cut off Russian supply lines. The attack was supported by significant artillery and air power.

### Berdiansk direction: Staromaiorske-Urozhaine

In the Berdiansk direction, Ukrainian forces launched a series of attacks aimed at retaking the villages of Staromaiorske and Urozhaine. These villages were key strongpoints in the Russian defenses.

## Eastern front

### Donetsk Oblast

In the Donetsk Oblast, Ukrainian forces launched a series of attacks aimed at retaking the city of Bakhmut and other key strongpoints. The fighting was intense, with both sides suffering significant losses.

## Dnieper front

Ukrainian forces also launched a series of attacks along the Dnieper River, aiming to retake key strongpoints and create a bridgehead for further advances.

## Behind front lines

### Crimea and the Black Sea

Ukrainian forces also launched a series of attacks behind the front lines, including in Crimea and the Black Sea. These attacks aimed to disrupt Russian supply lines and create chaos.

### Other areas

Ukrainian forces also launched attacks in other areas, including the Kharkiv and Zaporizhzhia regions.

## Result

The Ukrainian counteroffensive has achieved significant gains, with Ukrainian forces retaking key strongpoints and advancing deep into Russian-occupied territory. However, the fighting has been intense, and both sides have suffered significant losses.

# Strengths

## Personnel

The Ukrainian military has undergone significant reforms and modernization in recent years, with a focus on building a more professional and effective fighting force.

## Equipment

Ukrainian forces have received significant support from Western countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and other NATO members. This support has included advanced military equipment, including tanks, artillery, and air defense systems.

# Casualties and losses

## Ukraine

Ukrainian forces have suffered significant losses during the counteroffensive, including thousands of killed or wounded soldiers.

## Russia

Russian forces have also suffered significant losses, including thousands of killed or wounded soldiers. The Russian military has also lost significant amounts of equipment, including tanks, artillery, and air defense systems.

# Analysis

## Timeframe and progression

The Ukrainian counteroffensive has been months in the making, with Ukrainian military planners carefully studying Russian defenses and identifying vulnerabilities. The operation has been carefully planned and executed, with a focus on achieving significant gains while minimizing losses.

## Significance and goals

The Ukrainian counteroffensive is a significant turning point in the conflict, marking a shift in momentum in favor of Ukraine. The operation aims to reclaim territories occupied by Russian forces, create chaos and disruption behind the front lines, and ultimately achieve a decisive victory.

### Concerns

However, there are also concerns about the long-term sustainability of the Ukrainian counteroffensive. The operation has placed significant strain on Ukrainian forces, and there are concerns about the ability of the Ukrainian military to maintain the momentum of the operation.

## Tactics and equipment

### Russian minefields and fortifications

Russian forces have established complex networks of minefields and fortifications, which have presented significant challenges for Ukrainian forces.

### Artillery and aerial warfare

The conflict has seen significant use of artillery and aerial warfare, with both sides employing advanced systems to gain an advantage.

### Other tactics and equipment

Ukrainian forces have also employed a range of other tactics and equipment, including sabotage missions, drone attacks, and cyber warfare.

## Russian command

### Structure

The Russian military has a complex command structure, with multiple layers of command and control.

### Issues

However, the Russian military has also faced significant challenges, including issues with morale, logistics, and communication.

# Early reactions

## Governmental

The Ukrainian government has hailed the counteroffensive as a significant success, with President Volodymyr Zelensky praising the bravery and determination of Ukrainian forces.

## Russian information space and milbloggers

The Russian information space has been filled with conflicting reports and propaganda, with some milbloggers praising the bravery of Russian forces while others criticize the Russian military for its failures.

article:
Typhoon Hinnamnor

Typhoon Hinnamnor was a powerful tropical cyclone that affected Japan and South Korea in September 2022. The storm brought strong winds, heavy rainfall, and significant damage to both countries. As the eleventh named storm and the fifth typhoon of the season, Hinnamnor was a major weather event in the western Pacific.

# Meteorological history

Hinnamnor formed as a tropical depression on August 28, 2022, southeast of Okinawa, Japan. The system slowly intensified as it moved northwestward, becoming a tropical storm on August 30. The storm's name, Hinnamnor, was contributed by South Korea and means "jackfruit flower." On August 31, Hinnamnor intensified into a severe tropical storm, with maximum sustained winds of 95 km/h (59 mph).

Over the next few days, Hinnamnor continued to strengthen, becoming a typhoon on September 2. The storm's eye became more defined, and its outer rainbands expanded, bringing heavy rainfall to parts of Japan. On September 4, Hinnamnor reached its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of 165 km/h (103 mph) and a minimum central pressure of 935 hPa (27.61 inHg).

After reaching its peak, Hinnamnor began to weaken as it approached the Korean Peninsula. The storm made landfall in South Korea on September 6, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall to the region. Hinnamnor then moved northward, passing over North Korea and eventually dissipating on September 8.

# Preparations

## Japan

As Hinnamnor approached Japan, the government issued warnings and advisories for several prefectures. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) warned of strong winds, high waves, and heavy rainfall, especially in the southern island of Kyushu. The agency also advised residents to be prepared for power outages and flooding.

The Japanese government took several measures to prepare for the storm. The Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport, and Tourism (MLIT) announced that several expressways and highways would be closed as a precautionary measure. The Ministry of Defense also mobilized troops to assist in disaster response efforts.

## South Korea

In South Korea, the government issued a typhoon warning for several provinces, including Jeju Island and the southern coast. The Korea Meteorological Administration (KMA) warned of strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges, especially in coastal areas.

The South Korean government took several measures to prepare for the storm. The Ministry of the Interior and Safety announced that several public facilities, including schools and government offices, would be closed as a precautionary measure. The Ministry of Defense also mobilized troops to assist in disaster response efforts.

## Elsewhere

In other countries, including Taiwan and the Philippines, Hinnamnor brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, but no major damage was reported. The storm's outer rainbands also affected parts of China, including the provinces of Fujian and Jiangxi.

# Impact

## Japan

In Japan, Hinnamnor brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, especially in the southern island of Kyushu. The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 100,000 households affected. The storm also caused significant damage to agriculture, with several crops destroyed or damaged.

According to official reports, at least 20 people were injured in Japan, and over 1,000 homes were damaged or destroyed. The storm also caused significant disruptions to transportation, with several expressways and highways closed.

## South Korea

In South Korea, Hinnamnor brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, especially in the southern coast. The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 200,000 households affected. The storm also caused significant damage to agriculture, with several crops destroyed or damaged.

According to official reports, at least 10 people were killed in South Korea, and over 2,000 homes were damaged or destroyed. The storm also caused significant disruptions to transportation, with several roads and highways closed.

## Elsewhere

In other countries, including Taiwan and the Philippines, Hinnamnor brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, but no major damage was reported. The storm's outer rainbands also affected parts of China, including the provinces of Fujian and Jiangxi.

# Retirement

The name Hinnamnor was retired from the list of names for tropical cyclones in the western Pacific by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) in 2023. The name was replaced by a new name, which will be used in the future.

2022 The Hundred Season

The 2022 season of The Hundred was the second edition of the Hundred, a professional franchise 100-ball cricket tournament in England and Wales. The tournament was organized by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) and featured eight teams, with each team playing four home and four away matches in the group stage. The season began on August 3, 2022, and concluded on September 3, 2022.

# Teams

The eight teams that participated in the 2022 season of The Hundred were:

* Birmingham Phoenix
* London Spirit
* Manchester Originals
* Northern Superchargers
* Oval Invincibles
* Southern Brave
* Trent Rockets

2022 NHL Entry Draft

The 2022 NHL Entry Draft was the 60th NHL Entry Draft, held on July 7-8, 2022, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec. The draft was originally scheduled to take place on June 24-25, 2022, but was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The draft was hosted by the Montreal Canadiens, who had the first overall pick in the draft.

# Eligibility

The 2022 NHL Entry Draft was open to players who were born between January 1, 2002, and September 15, 2004. Players who were not selected in the 2020 or 2021 NHL Entry Drafts were also eligible to be selected in the 2022 draft. The eligibility rules were established by the National Hockey League (NHL) and the National Hockey League Players' Association (NHLPA).

# Draft Lottery

The NHL held a draft lottery on May 10, 2022, to determine the order of the top 16 picks in the draft. The lottery was used to determine the order of the teams that missed the playoffs in the 2021-22 NHL season. The Montreal Canadiens won the lottery and earned the first overall pick in the draft.

# Top Prospects

Several top prospects were eligible to be selected in the 2022 NHL Entry Draft. Some of the top prospects included:

* Juraj Slafkovsky, a left wing from Slovakia
* Logan Cooley, a center from the United States
* Simon Nemec, a defenseman from Slovakia
* David Jiricek, a defenseman from the Czech Republic
* Cutter Gauthier, a left wing from the United States

# Selections by Round

## Round One

The first round of the draft took place on July 7, 2022. The Montreal Canadiens selected Juraj Slafkovsky with the first overall pick. Other notable picks in the first round included Logan Cooley, selected by the Arizona Coyotes with the third overall pick, and Simon Nemec, selected by the New Jersey Devils with the second overall pick.

## Round Two

The second round of the draft took place on July 8, 2022. The Montreal Canadiens selected Owen Beck with the 33rd overall pick. Other notable picks in the second round included Landon Slaggert, selected by the Chicago Blackhawks with the 39th overall pick, and Topi Ronni, selected by the Carolina Hurricanes with the 59th overall pick.

## Round Three

The third round of the draft took place on July 8, 2022. The Montreal Canadiens selected Miguël Tourigny with the 67th overall pick. Other notable picks in the third round included Devin Kaplan, selected by the Philadelphia Flyers with the 69th overall pick, and Yaniv Perets, selected by the Seattle Kraken with the 80th overall pick.

## Round Four

The fourth round of the draft took place on July 8, 2022. The Montreal Canadiens selected Cedrick Guindon with the 127th overall pick. Other notable picks in the fourth round included Ben Hemmerling, selected by the Vegas Golden Knights with the 115th overall pick, and Camden Thiesing, selected by the Minnesota Wild with the 124th overall pick.

## Round Five

The fifth round of the draft took place on July 8, 2022. The Montreal Canadiens selected Jared Davidson with the 130th overall pick. Other notable picks in the fifth round included Nicholas Moldenhauer, selected by the Toronto Maple Leafs with the 144th overall pick, and Eric Alarie, selected by the Los Angeles Kings with the 154th overall pick.

## Round Six

The sixth round of the draft took place on July 8, 2022. The Montreal Canadiens selected Emmet Croteau with the 162nd overall pick. Other notable picks in the sixth round included Hunter Haight, selected by the Minnesota Wild with the 172nd overall pick, and Jake Pinehurst, selected by the Columbus Blue Jackets with the 177th overall pick.

## Round Seven

The seventh round of the draft took place on July 8, 2022. The Montreal Canadiens selected Petteri Nurmi with the 194th overall pick. Other notable picks in the seventh round included Matej Kaslik, selected by the Philadelphia Flyers with the 210th overall pick, and Dominik Rymon, selected by the Colorado Avalanche with the 220th overall pick.

2022 FINA World Swimming Championships (25 m)

The 2022 FINA World Swimming Championships (25 m) were the 16th edition of the FINA World Swimming Championships (25 m), which were held from December 13 to 18, 2022, in Melbourne, Australia.

# Qualification

The qualification period for the 2022 FINA World Swimming Championships (25 m) took place from January 1, 2022, to December 12, 2022. Each National Federation was allowed to enter a maximum of two swimmers per event, with the exception of the 4x50m and 4x100m relays, where four swimmers could be entered. Swimmers who achieved the qualifying standard set by FINA were eligible to participate in the championships.

# Schedule

The championships took place over six days, with competition held in two sessions per day. The morning sessions featured heats and semifinals, while the evening sessions featured finals and medal ceremonies. The schedule was as follows:

* December 13: Day 1 (morning and evening sessions)
* December 14: Day 2 (morning and evening sessions)

article:
2022 United States Elections

The 2022 United States elections were held on November 8, 2022, to elect members of the 118th Congress, governors, and other state and local officials. These mid-term elections were seen as a critical test of the presidency of Joe Biden and the direction of the country.

# Background

The 2022 elections took place during a period of significant polarization and division in the United States. The COVID-19 pandemic had caused widespread disruption and economic hardship, and the country was still grappling with the aftermath of the 2020 presidential election. The elections were also influenced by the ongoing controversy over abortion rights, gun violence, and climate change.

# Campaign

The 2022 campaign season was marked by intense competition and record-breaking spending. Candidates from both parties focused on key issues such as the economy, abortion, and crime, and sought to mobilize their bases and appeal to swing voters.

## Primaries

The primary season began in March 2022 and lasted for several months. Many incumbent members of Congress and governors faced challenges from within their own parties, while others retired or declined to run for re-election. The primaries saw the emergence of several high-profile candidates, including newcomers and established politicians.

## Issues

### Economy

The economy was a major issue in the 2022 elections, with candidates debating the best ways to promote growth, reduce inflation, and address income inequality. Democrats emphasized the need for government investment in infrastructure and social programs, while Republicans called for tax cuts and deregulation.

### Abortion

The Supreme Court's decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, which overturned Roe v. Wade and abolished the constitutional right to abortion, made abortion a central issue in the 2022 elections. Democrats vowed to protect and expand access to reproductive health care, while Republicans sought to restrict or ban abortion altogether.

### Crime and Gun Violence

Crime and gun violence were also major concerns in the 2022 elections, particularly in the wake of high-profile mass shootings. Democrats called for stricter gun control laws and increased funding for community policing, while Republicans emphasized the need for tougher sentencing and border security.

### Democracy

The health of American democracy was another key issue in the 2022 elections, with many candidates debating the need for electoral reform, voting rights protections, and campaign finance overhaul. Democrats emphasized the importance of protecting voting rights and promoting transparency in government, while Republicans called for stricter voter ID laws and election security measures.

### Education

Education was a critical issue in the 2022 elections, particularly with regards to school funding, teacher pay, and curriculum standards. Democrats emphasized the need for increased investment in public education and student loan forgiveness, while Republicans called for expanded school choice options and reduced federal involvement in education policy.

### Climate Change

Climate change was a growing concern in the 2022 elections, with many candidates debating the need for urgent action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and transition to renewable energy. Democrats emphasized the importance of investing in clean energy and promoting sustainable infrastructure, while Republicans called for reduced regulations and increased fossil fuel production.

### Immigration

Immigration was another key issue in the 2022 elections, particularly with regards to border security, asylum policy, and pathways to citizenship. Democrats emphasized the need for comprehensive immigration reform and protections for Dreamers, while Republicans called for stricter border enforcement and reduced immigration levels.

### Student Loan Forgiveness

Student loan forgiveness was a major issue in the 2022 elections, particularly among younger voters. Democrats emphasized the need for debt relief and free or reduced-cost college, while Republicans called for reduced federal involvement in higher education and increased private sector investment.

### Presidency of Joe Biden

The presidency of Joe Biden was a major factor in the 2022 elections, with many candidates debating the success or failure of his policies and leadership style. Democrats emphasized the need to protect and build on Biden's achievements, while Republicans called for a change in direction and criticized Biden's handling of key issues.

### Russian Invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine was a major international issue in the 2022 elections, with many candidates debating the need for increased military aid and diplomatic support for Ukraine. Democrats emphasized the importance of standing up to Russian aggression and promoting global stability, while Republicans called for reduced U.S. involvement in foreign conflicts and increased focus on domestic issues.

## Campaign Spending

The 2022 elections saw record-breaking campaign spending, with candidates and outside groups investing billions of dollars in advertising, grassroots organizing, and get-out-the-vote efforts. The spending was fueled in part by the Citizens United decision, which allowed corporations and other outside groups to contribute unlimited funds to political campaigns.

# Federal Elections

The 2022 federal elections included elections for the House of Representatives, the Senate, and various other federal offices.

## Senate Elections

The 2022 Senate elections saw 34 seats up for grabs, with Democrats defending 14 seats and Republicans defending 20. Several high-profile Senate races were closely contested, including in Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and Arizona.

### Special Elections

Several special Senate elections were held in 2022, including in Oklahoma, where Republican Markwayne Mullin won a seat vacated by Jim Inhofe, and in Kansas, where Republican Jerry Moran won re-election.

### Post-Election Party Switches

Following the 2022 elections, several Senators switched parties, including Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona, who became an independent, and Raphael Warnock of Georgia, who switched to the Democratic Party.

## House of Representatives Elections

The 2022 House elections saw all 435 seats up for grabs, with Democrats defending 220 seats and Republicans defending 212. Several high-profile House races were closely contested, including in California, New York, and Texas.

### Special Elections

Several special House elections were held in 2022, including in Texas, where Republican Mayra Flores won a seat vacated by Filemon Vela, and in New York, where Democrat Pat Ryan won a seat vacated by Antonio Delgado.

# State Elections

The 2022 state elections included elections for governors, state legislatures, and various other state offices.

## Gubernatorial Elections

The 2022 gubernatorial elections saw 36 seats up for grabs, with Democrats defending 16 seats and Republicans defending 20. Several high-profile gubernatorial races were closely contested, including in Arizona, Georgia, and Pennsylvania.

## Other State Executive Elections

Several other state executive elections were held in 2022, including elections for lieutenant governor, attorney general, and secretary of state.

## State Judicial Elections

The 2022 state judicial elections saw several high-profile races, including in Texas, where Republicans won several seats on the state supreme court, and in Ohio, where Democrats won several seats on the state supreme court.

## Legislative Elections

The 2022 state legislative elections saw several high-profile races, including in California, where Democrats won several seats in the state assembly, and in Texas, where Republicans won several seats in the state house.

## Referendums

Several state referendums were held in 2022, including in California, where voters approved a measure to enshrine the right to abortion in the state constitution, and in Florida, where voters approved a measure to limit property tax increases.

## Results

The 2022 elections saw Democrats win several key Senate seats, including in Pennsylvania and Arizona, while Republicans won several key House seats, including in Texas and Florida. The elections also saw several high-profile gubernatorial races, including in Georgia and Pennsylvania.

## January 2023 Speaker Election

Following the 2022 elections, the House of Representatives held a contentious speaker election, with several candidates vying for the top spot. Ultimately, Kevin McCarthy won the speakership on the 15th ballot.

## Analysis

The 2022 elections were widely seen as a referendum on the presidency of Joe Biden and the direction of the country. The elections saw significant turnout, particularly among younger voters and voters of color.

### Close Results

Edwards Vacuum
===============

Edwards Vacuum is a leading global provider of vacuum and abatement solutions, serving a wide range of industries including semiconductors, LEDs, flat panels, and pharmaceuticals. The company has a rich history dating back to 1919 and has undergone significant transformations over the years.

History
-------

### Independent (1919-1967)

Edwards Vacuum was founded in 1919 by F.D. Edwards in London, UK. Initially, the company focused on producing vacuum pumps and other equipment for industrial applications. During the 1920s and 1930s, Edwards Vacuum expanded its product line to include vacuum gauges, valves, and other related accessories. The company quickly gained a reputation for producing high-quality vacuum equipment and became a leading supplier to various industries.

### BOC (1968-2006)

In 1968, Edwards Vacuum was acquired by the British Oxygen Company (BOC), a leading industrial gases company. Under BOC's ownership, Edwards Vacuum continued to grow and expand its product line. The company introduced new vacuum pumps and systems, including the iconic Edwards E2M vacuum pump, which became a standard in the industry. During the 1980s, Edwards Vacuum began to focus on the emerging semiconductor industry, providing vacuum solutions for the production of microchips.

### Linde and CCMP Capital (2006-2014)

In 2006, BOC was acquired by Linde AG, a German industrial gases company. As a result, Edwards Vacuum became a subsidiary of Linde. In 2007, CCMP Capital, a private equity firm, acquired a majority stake in Edwards Vacuum from Linde. Under CCMP's ownership, Edwards Vacuum continued to expand its product line and entered new markets, including the solar and LED industries.

### Atlas Copco (2014-present)

In 2014, Atlas Copco, a Swedish industrial equipment company, acquired Edwards Vacuum from CCMP Capital. The acquisition marked a new chapter in Edwards Vacuum's history, providing access to new markets and resources. Under Atlas Copco's ownership, Edwards Vacuum continues to innovate and expand its product line, focusing on sustainable and energy-efficient solutions.

Products and Markets
-------------------

### 1950-60s

During the 1950s and 1960s, Edwards Vacuum focused on producing vacuum pumps, gauges, and valves for industrial applications. The company's products were used in various industries, including chemical processing, food processing, and pharmaceuticals.

### 1970s

In the 1970s, Edwards Vacuum began to focus on the emerging semiconductor industry. The company introduced new vacuum pumps and systems designed specifically for the production of microchips. Edwards Vacuum's products quickly gained popularity among semiconductor manufacturers, and the company became a leading supplier to the industry.

### 1980s

During the 1980s, Edwards Vacuum expanded its product line to include vacuum solutions for the production of flat panel displays. The company's products were used in the manufacture of LCD and plasma TVs, as well as computer monitors.

### 1990s

In the 1990s, Edwards Vacuum entered the pharmaceutical industry, providing vacuum solutions for the production of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs). The company's products were used in various applications, including freeze-drying, distillation, and crystallization.

### Recent

In recent years, Edwards Vacuum has focused on developing sustainable and energy-efficient solutions for various industries. The company has introduced new vacuum pumps and systems designed to reduce energy consumption and minimize environmental impact. Edwards Vacuum's products are used in various applications, including solar panel manufacturing, LED production, and pharmaceutical processing.

Edwards Lecture Series

The series features lectures by leading experts in the field, covering topics such as vacuum science, materials science, and industrial applications. The Edwards Lecture Series is held at various locations around the world and is attended by industry professionals, academics, and researchers.

Controversies
-------------

### Domain Registration

In 2019, Edwards Vacuum was involved in a controversy surrounding the registration of the domain name "edwardsvacuum.com". The company had registered the domain name in 1995, but it had expired in 2018. A third-party company, Domain Name Sales, had acquired the domain name and was offering it for sale. Edwards Vacuum claimed that the domain name was its intellectual property and demanded that Domain Name Sales transfer it back to the company. The dispute was eventually resolved, with Edwards Vacuum regaining control of the domain name.

### Hoffman Instrumentation Supply Inc

In 2018, Edwards Vacuum was sued by Hoffman Instrumentation Supply Inc (HIS), a US-based company that claimed that Edwards Vacuum had infringed its patent for a vacuum pump design. HIS alleged that Edwards Vacuum's E2M vacuum pump infringed its patent and sought damages and an injunction. The case was eventually settled out of court, with Edwards Vacuum agreeing to pay an undisclosed sum to HIS.

The Little Mermaid (2023 film)

The Little Mermaid is a 2023 American musical fantasy film directed by Rob Marshall, based on the 1837 Danish fairy tale of the same name by Hans Christian Andersen. The film is a live-action reimagining of the 1989 Disney animated film of the same name. The movie features an all-star cast, including Halle Bailey, Melissa McCarthy, and Jonah Hauer-King, and follows the story of Ariel, a young mermaid who dreams of exploring the world above the sea.

# Plot

The film tells the story of Ariel, a young and adventurous mermaid who lives under the sea with her father, King Triton, and her fish friends, Flounder and Scuttle. Ariel is fascinated by the world above the sea and longs to explore it. One day, she falls in love with Prince Eric, a human who is sailing on a ship in the sea. Ariel makes a deal with the sea witch, Ursula, to trade her voice for a pair of legs, allowing her to go on land to meet Prince Eric.

However, Ursula has her own motives and plans to use Ariel's voice to seduce Prince Eric and marry him herself. Meanwhile, Ariel must navigate the complexities of human life and win Prince Eric's heart before Ursula's plan is set in motion. Along the way, Ariel befriends Prince Eric's servant, Grimsby, and his dog, Max, who help her in her quest.

# Cast

* Melissa McCarthy as Ursula
* Jonah Hauer-King as Prince Eric

# Production

## Development

The project was first announced in 2016, with Disney acquiring the rights to the original fairy tale. Rob Marshall was brought on board to direct the film, and Lin-Manuel Miranda was hired to write new music for the movie. The film's script was written by David Magee, with a story by Magee, Marshall, and Miranda.

## Casting

Halle Bailey was cast as Ariel in July 2019, after a long and extensive casting process. Melissa McCarthy was cast as Ursula in October 2019, and Jonah Hauer-King was cast as Prince Eric in November 2019. The rest of the cast was announced in the following months, with Jacob Tremblay, Awkwafina, and Javier Bardem joining the cast as Flounder, Scuttle, and King Triton, respectively.

## Filming

Principal photography began in March 2020, in Pinewood Studios in London. The film was shot on a combination of soundstages and location shoots, with the production team building a large tank to film the underwater scenes. The film's cinematography was handled by Dion Beebe, who used a combination of digital and practical effects to bring the underwater world to life.

## Visual effects

The film's visual effects were handled by MPC, who worked closely with the production team to create the film's elaborate underwater sequences. The team used a combination of digital and practical effects to bring the mermaids and sea creatures to life, with the film's visual effects supervisor, Gary Brozenich, overseeing the process.

### Lawsuit

The film received a mixed reaction from fans and critics before its release, with some praising the film's visuals and others criticizing the film's casting choices. The film's trailer was met with a mixed reaction, with some fans expressing disappointment at the film's lack of diversity.

2022 WDF World Darts Championship

The 2022 WDF World Darts Championship was the 27th edition of the World Darts Federation's (WDF) flagship event, taking place from April 2 to 10, 2022, at the Lakeside Country Club in Frimley Green, Surrey, England. The tournament was the first to be held since the 2020 edition, as the 2021 event was cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

#Prize money

The total prize money for the 2022 WDF World Darts Championship was £300,000, with the men's champion receiving £50,000 and the women's champion receiving £20,000. The prize money was distributed among the participants as follows:

article:
Pathaan (film)
================

Pathaan is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language action-thriller film directed by Siddharth Anand and written by Shridhar Raghavan and Abbas Tyrewala. The film is produced by Aditya Chopra under the banner of Yash Raj Films (YRF) and stars Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone, and John Abraham in the lead roles. Pathaan marks the fourth installment in the YRF Spy Universe, following Ek Tha Tiger (2012), Tiger Zinda Hai (2017), and War (2019).

Plot
=====

The film follows the story of Pathaan (Shah Rukh Khan), a highly skilled and deadly agent who works for the Indian intelligence agency, Research and Analysis Wing (R&AW). Pathaan is assigned to take down a rogue agent, Jim (John Abraham), who has gone against the country and is working with a terrorist organization to spread chaos and destruction. As Pathaan delves deeper into the mission, he teams up with Rubina (Deepika Padukone), a skilled agent, to take down Jim and his associates. The film is a high-octane action-packed thriller with plenty of twists and turns that keep the audience on the edge of their seats.

Cast
=====

* Shah Rukh Khan as Pathaan
* Deepika Padukone as Rubina
* John Abraham as Jim
* Dimple Kapadia as Nandini
* Ashutosh Rana as Colonel Sunil Luthra
* Manush Chudari as Amandeep

Production
==========

### Development

Pathaan was first announced in 2019, with Siddharth Anand set to direct the film. The film's script was written by Shridhar Raghavan and Abbas Tyrewala, with Aditya Chopra serving as the producer. The film is part of the YRF Spy Universe, which also includes Ek Tha Tiger, Tiger Zinda Hai, and War.

### Casting

Shah Rukh Khan was the first actor to be cast in the film, followed by Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. The film's cast also includes Dimple Kapadia, Ashutosh Rana, and Manush Chudari in supporting roles.

### Filming

Principal photography for the film began in November 2020, with the film's team shooting in various locations across the world, including India, the United Arab Emirates, and Spain. The film's action sequences were choreographed by Yannick Ben, while the cinematography was handled by Satchith Paulose.

Music
=====

The film's music was composed by Vishal-Shekhar, with lyrics written by Kumaar. The film's soundtrack features five songs, including the hit single "Besharam Rang", which was sung by Shilpa Rao, Caralisa Monteiro, and Vishal Dadlani. The film's score was composed by Sanchit Balhara and Ankit Balhara.

Controversy
==========

Pathaan was surrounded by controversy even before its release, with several right-wing groups protesting against the film's song "Besharam Rang". The song, which features Deepika Padukone in a saffron-colored bikini, was deemed "objectionable" by several groups, who claimed that it was an insult to the Hindu religion.

Marketing
=========

The film's marketing campaign was handled by YRF, with the film's trailer being released in January 2023. The film's team also released several promotional videos and posters, featuring the film's lead actors.

Release
=======

### Theatrical

Pathaan was released in theaters on January 25, 2023, in India and other countries. The film was released in over 5,000 screens across the world, making it one of the widest releases of an Indian film.

### Home media

The film's digital rights were acquired by Amazon Prime Video, which released the film on its platform on March 22, 2023.

Reception
==========

### Critical response

#### India

Pathaan received mixed reviews from Indian critics, with several praising the film's action sequences and performances, while others criticized the film's script and direction. The Times of India gave the film 3.5 out of 5 stars, praising Shah Rukh Khan's performance and the film's action sequences. However, the Hindustan Times gave the film 2 out of 5 stars, criticizing the film's script and direction.

#### International

Pathaan received generally positive reviews from international critics, with several praising the film's action sequences and performances. The Hollywood Reporter gave the film a positive review, praising Shah Rukh Khan's performance and the film's action sequences. However, The Guardian gave the film a mixed review, criticizing the film's script and direction.

### Box office

Pathaan was a major commercial success, grossing over ₹1,000 crore (US$130 million) worldwide. The film grossed ₹550 crore (US$69 million) in India and ₹450 crore (US$56 million) overseas, making it one of the highest-grossing Indian films of all time.

Future
======

### Pathaan 2

In February 2023, YRF announced that a sequel to Pathaan was in the works, with Siddharth Anand set to direct the film. The film's script is currently being written, with Shah Rukh Khan set to reprise his role as Pathaan.

### Tiger vs Pathaan

In March 2023, YRF announced that a crossover film featuring Shah Rukh Khan's Pathaan and Salman Khan's Tiger was in the works. The film, titled Tiger vs Pathaan, will be directed by Siddharth Anand and is set to release in 2025.

Accolades
==========

Pathaan won several awards and nominations, including the Filmfare Award for Best Actor for Shah Rukh Khan.

Notes
=====

References
==========

External links
==============

Football at the 2021 SEA Games – Men's tournament

The men's football tournament at the 2021 Southeast Asian Games was the 31st edition of the men's football tournament at the Southeast Asian Games, an international football tournament held every two years among the national teams of the 11 Southeast Asian nations. The tournament took place in Vietnam from 6 to 22 May 2022.

#Competition schedule

The tournament began on 6 May 2022 and concluded on 22 May 2022.

article:
Shinzo Abe

Shinzo Abe was a Japanese politician who served as the Prime Minister of Japan from 2006 to 2007 and again from 2012 to 2020. He was the longest-serving prime minister in Japanese history, known for his conservative views and his efforts to revitalize the country's economy and military.

#Early life

##Family

Shinzo Abe was born on September 21, 1954, in Tokyo, Japan, to a prominent political family. His father, Shintaro Abe, was a politician who served as the Minister of Foreign Affairs, and his mother, Yoko Abe, was a homemaker. Abe's grandfather, Nobusuke Kishi, was a politician who served as the Prime Minister of Japan from 1957 to 1960. Abe's family has a long history of involvement in politics, and he was raised with the expectation of following in their footsteps.

##Education and early career

Abe attended Seikei Elementary School and Seikei Junior High School, and then went on to study politics at Seikei University. After graduating from university, Abe worked as a secretary to his father, who was then the Minister of Foreign Affairs. In 1982, Abe joined the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, where he worked as a diplomat until 1986.

#Member of the House of Representatives

In 1986, Abe was elected to the House of Representatives, the lower house of the Japanese parliament, representing the Yamaguchi 1st district. He was 31 years old at the time, making him one of the youngest members of parliament in Japanese history. Abe quickly rose through the ranks of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), becoming a member of the party's executive council in 1993.

#First term as prime minister (2006–2007)

##Inauguration and cabinet

Abe was elected as the President of the LDP in 2006, and subsequently became the Prime Minister of Japan on September 26, 2006. He was 52 years old at the time, making him one of the youngest prime ministers in Japanese history. Abe's cabinet included several prominent politicians, including Taro Aso as Minister of Foreign Affairs and Yasuhisa Shiozaki as Minister of Health, Labour and Welfare.

##Domestic policy

During his first term as prime minister, Abe focused on domestic policy issues, including education reform and pension reform. He also implemented several policies aimed at promoting economic growth, including the creation of a new ministry for economic revival.

##Foreign policy

Abe's foreign policy during his first term was marked by a focus on strengthening Japan's relationships with its neighbors, particularly China and South Korea. He also made several high-profile visits to East Asia, including a trip to China in 2006.

###North Korea

Abe's policy towards North Korea was marked by a hardline approach, including a refusal to provide economic aid to the country until it abandoned its nuclear program.

###East and Southeast Asia

Abe's policy towards East and Southeast Asia focused on promoting economic integration and cooperation. He played a key role in the establishment of the East Asia Summit, a regional forum aimed at promoting economic and security cooperation.

###India

Abe's policy towards India focused on promoting economic cooperation and security ties. He made several high-profile visits to India, including a trip in 2006.

##Defense

Abe's defense policy during his first term focused on strengthening Japan's military capabilities, including the creation of a new defense ministry.

##Resignation

Abe resigned as prime minister on September 12, 2007, citing health reasons. He was succeeded by Yasuo Fukuda.

#Out of office (2007–2012)

After resigning as prime minister, Abe remained a member of the House of Representatives, but took a lower profile in politics. He continued to serve as a member of the LDP's executive council, but did not hold any major party or government positions.

#Second LDP presidency and 2012 general election

In 2012, Abe was re-elected as the President of the LDP, and subsequently became the Prime Minister of Japan again on December 26, 2012. The 2012 general election was marked by a landslide victory for the LDP, which won 294 seats in the 480-member House of Representatives.

#Second term as prime minister (2012–2014)

##Economic policy

During his second term as prime minister, Abe focused on economic policy issues, including the implementation of a new economic policy package known as "Abenomics."

###"First Arrow": Monetary policy

The first arrow of Abenomics was a monetary policy aimed at increasing the money supply and stimulating economic growth. The policy included a 2% inflation target and a commitment to increase the money supply by 60-70 trillion yen per year.

###"Second Arrow": Fiscal policy

The second arrow of Abenomics was a fiscal policy aimed at stimulating economic growth through government spending. The policy included a commitment to increase government spending by 10 trillion yen per year.

###"Third Arrow": Growth strategy and structural reform

The third arrow of Abenomics was a growth strategy and structural reform aimed at promoting economic growth through deregulation and structural reform. The policy included a commitment to promote economic growth through deregulation and structural reform.

##2013 Upper House election

The 2013 Upper House election was marked by a victory for the LDP, which won 65 seats in the 242-member House of Councillors.

##Domestic policy

During his second term as prime minister, Abe focused on domestic policy issues, including education reform and pension reform. He also implemented several policies aimed at promoting economic growth, including the creation of a new ministry for economic revival.

##Foreign policy

Abe's foreign policy during his second term was marked by a focus on strengthening Japan's relationships with its neighbors, particularly China and South Korea. He also made several high-profile visits to East Asia, including a trip to China in 2013.

##Defense and security policy

Abe's defense and security policy during his second term focused on strengthening Japan's military capabilities, including the creation of a new defense ministry.

##2014 cabinet reshuffle

In September 2014, Abe reshuffled his cabinet, appointing several new ministers, including Sanae Takaichi as Minister of Internal Affairs and Communications.

##2014 general election

The 2014 general election was marked by a victory for the LDP, which won 291 seats in the 475-member House of Representatives.

#Third term as prime minister (2014–2017)

##Foreign policy

Abe's foreign policy during his third term was marked by a focus on strengthening Japan's relationships with its neighbors, particularly China and South Korea. He also made several high-profile visits to East Asia, including a trip to China in 2015.

##Security and defense issues

Abe's security and defense policy during his third term focused on strengthening Japan's military capabilities, including the creation of a new defense ministry.

##Re-election as LDP president and "Abenomics 2.0"

In 2015, Abe was re-elected as the President of the LDP, and subsequently became the Prime Minister of Japan again. He announced a new economic policy package known as "Abenomics 2.0," which included several measures aimed at promoting economic growth.

##Constitutional revision

Abe's policy on constitutional revision focused on revising the Japanese Constitution to allow for the exercise of collective self-defense.

#Fourth term as prime minister (2017–2020)

##Re-election as LDP president

In 2017, Abe was re-elected as the President of the LDP, and subsequently became the Prime Minister of Japan again.

##Favoritism scandals

Abe's fourth term was marked by several favoritism scandals, including a scandal involving the sale of public land to a private school operator.

##Foreign policy

Abe's foreign policy during his fourth term was marked by a focus on strengthening Japan's relationships with its neighbors, particularly China and South Korea. He also made several high-profile visits to East Asia, including a trip to China in 2018.

##Economic policy

Abe's economic policy during his fourth term focused on promoting economic growth through deregulation and structural reform.

##Whaling

Abe's policy on whaling focused on promoting Japan's whaling industry, despite international criticism.

##Resignation

Abe resigned as prime minister on August 28, 2020, citing health reasons. He was succeeded by Yoshihide Suga.

#Assassination

Abe was assassinated on July 8, 2022, while campaigning for the LDP in the city of Nara. He was shot twice by a homemade shotgun and died shortly after arrival at the hospital.

#Controversies and issues

##Historical negationism

Abe's views on history have been the subject of controversy, particularly with regards to his views on the Nanking Massacre and the use of comfort women during World War II.

##Response to the mass media

Abe's government has been criticized for its response to the mass media, particularly with regards to the use of state secrets laws to restrict press freedom.

##Yasukuni Shrine

Abe's visits to the Yasukuni Shrine have been the subject of controversy, particularly with regards to the shrine's perceived connection to Japanese militarism.

##Photographs with "731"

Abe has been criticized for posing for photographs with members of the Japanese nationalist group "731," which has been accused of promoting hate speech and violence.

##Restoration of Sovereignty Day

Abe's government has been criticized for promoting the celebration of "Restoration of Sovereignty Day," which is seen as a celebration of Japan's colonial past.

##Migratory policies

Abe's government has been criticized for its migratory policies, particularly with regards to the treatment of refugees and asylum seekers.

#Personal life

Abe was married to Akie Abe, a former radio DJ and social activist. They had no children.

#Legacy

Abe's legacy is complex and multifaceted. He is remembered for his efforts to revitalize the Japanese economy and promote economic growth, as well as his efforts to strengthen Japan's military capabilities and promote national security. However, his views on history and his response to the mass media have been the subject of controversy.

#Honors, awards and international recognition

##Domestic honors

Abe received several domestic honors and awards, including the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Chrysanthemum and the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Paulownia Flowers.

##Foreign honors

Abe received several foreign honors and awards, including the Grand Cross of the Order of the Legion of Honour and the Grand Cross of the Order of the Crown.

##Other honors

Abe received several other honors and awards, including the Woodrow Wilson Award for Public Service and the Order of the Aztec Eagle.

##Awards

Abe received several awards, including the TIME 100 and the Forbes World's Most Powerful People.

##Honorary doctorates

Abe received several honorary doctorates, including from the University of Tokyo and the University of Oxford.

article:
Sleeping Beauty (1959 film)

Sleeping Beauty is a 1959 American animated fantasy film produced by Walt Disney Productions and based on the classic fairy tale "La Belle au Bois Dormant" by Charles Perrault and the Brothers Grimm. The film tells the story of Princess Aurora, a beautiful and kind-hearted princess who is placed under a sleeping curse by the evil fairy Maleficent. With the help of a group of good fairies and a brave prince, Aurora must be awakened from her eternal slumber and defeat the forces of evil.

#Plot

The film begins with the birth of Princess Aurora, the daughter of King Stefan and Queen Leah. The entire kingdom is invited to the celebration of Aurora's birth, except for the evil fairy Maleficent, who is angry at not being invited. Maleficent curses the princess, declaring that on her 16th birthday, Aurora will prick her finger on a spinning wheel and fall into a deep sleep, never to awaken. The good fairies, Flora, Fauna, and Merryweather, try to weaken the curse by declaring that instead of dying, Aurora will fall into a deep sleep that can only be broken by the kiss of true love.

The film then jumps forward to Aurora's 16th birthday, where she meets Prince Philip, a handsome and charming prince who has fallen in love with her. However, their love is put to the test when Maleficent disguises herself as an old hag and tricks Aurora into pricking her finger on a spinning wheel. The curse is fulfilled, and Aurora falls into a deep sleep.

The good fairies try to stop Maleficent, but she is too powerful. They decide to put the entire kingdom to sleep, hoping that when Aurora awakens, the kingdom will also awaken. Prince Philip battles Maleficent and her minions, but he is captured and imprisoned. The good fairies help Philip escape, and he makes his way to the sleeping Aurora. He kisses her, breaking the curse, and Aurora awakens.

The film ends with the wedding of Aurora and Philip, surrounded by their friends and family. Maleficent is punished for her evil deeds, and the kingdom celebrates the happiness of the young couple.

#Voice cast

* Mary Costa as Princess Aurora/Briar Rose
* Bill Shirley as Prince Philip
* Eleanor Audley as Maleficent
* Verna Felton as Flora
* Barbara Jo Allen as Fauna
* Barbara Luderowski as Merryweather
* Taylor Holmes as King Stefan
* Bill Thompson as King Hubert
* Candy Candido as Maleficent's goon
* Pinto Colvig as Maleficent's goon
* Bob Amsberry as Maleficent's goon

#Production

##Story development

Walt Disney had been interested in adapting "Sleeping Beauty" into an animated film since the 1930s. However, the project was put on hold due to World War II and the failure of Pinocchio. In the 1950s, Disney revived the project, and a team of writers and artists began working on the story.

The original fairy tale by Charles Perrault and the Brothers Grimm was quite dark, and Disney wanted to make the story more suitable for children. The writers added new characters, such as the good fairies and Prince Philip, to make the story more appealing to children.

##Casting

The voice cast for the film was carefully selected. Mary Costa, a young singer, was chosen to play the role of Princess Aurora. Bill Shirley, a Broadway actor, was chosen to play the role of Prince Philip. Eleanor Audley, a veteran voice actress, was chosen to play the role of Maleficent.

##Production delays

The production of Sleeping Beauty was plagued by delays. The film was originally scheduled for release in 1955, but it was pushed back to 1957, and finally to 1959. The delays were due to the complexity of the animation and the need for perfection.

##Animation

###Art direction

The art direction for the film was led by Eyvind Earle, a renowned artist and designer. Earle was responsible for creating the look and feel of the film, including the characters, settings, and special effects. He was inspired by medieval art and architecture, and he created a unique and distinctive style for the film.

###Live-action reference

To create realistic animation, the animators used live-action reference. Actors were filmed performing the scenes, and the animators used the footage as a reference point. This technique helped to create a more realistic and believable animation.

###Character animation

The character animation for the film was led by a team of experienced animators, including Milt Kahl, Frank Thomas, and Ollie Johnston. The animators used a combination of traditional animation techniques and new technologies, such as the Multiplane camera, to create complex and detailed animation.

##Music

The music for the film was composed by George Bruns, with lyrics by Erdman Penner, Winston Hibler, and Walter Sheets. The film's iconic score includes the songs "Once Upon a Dream," "I Wonder," and "Sleeping Beauty Waltz." The music was performed by the Disney Studio Orchestra, with vocals by Mary Costa and Bill Shirley.

#Release

##Original theatrical run

Sleeping Beauty was released on January 29, 1959, at the Radio City Music Hall in New York City. The film was a critical and commercial success, and it became one of the highest-grossing films of the year.

##Re-releases

The film was re-released in 1970, 1979, 1986, and 1995. Each re-release was successful, and the film continued to be a beloved classic.

##Home media

Sleeping Beauty was first released on home video in 1986, on VHS and LaserDisc. The film was later released on DVD in 1997, and on Blu-ray in 2008. The film's 50th anniversary edition was released in 2008, featuring a restored and remastered version of the film.

###Lawsuit

In 1997, a lawsuit was filed against Disney by a group of artists who claimed that they had been denied royalties for their work on the film. The lawsuit was settled out of court, with Disney agreeing to pay the artists a percentage of the film's profits.

#Reception

##Critical response

Sleeping Beauty received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. The film's animation, music, and storytelling were praised by critics, and it became one of the highest-rated films of the year.

##Accolades

The film won several awards, including the Academy Award for Best Original Score. The film was also nominated for Best Original Song for "Once Upon a Dream."

#Legacy

Sleeping Beauty has become a beloved classic, and its influence can be seen in many other films and TV shows. The film's iconic characters, such as Maleficent and Prince Philip, have become cultural icons. The film's music, particularly "Once Upon a Dream," has become a timeless classic.

article:
Karl R. Free

Karl R. Free (1903-1947) was an American painter, best known for his work on post office murals in the 1930s. His artwork often depicted everyday life, landscapes, and historical scenes. Free's murals were commissioned by the United States government as part of the New Deal program, aimed at promoting art and providing employment to artists during the Great Depression.

#Early years

Karl R. Free was born in 1903 in Ohio, United States. He grew up in a family of modest means and developed an interest in art from an early age. Free's talent was recognized by his teachers, who encouraged him to pursue a career in the arts. He went on to study at the Cleveland School of Art, where he honed his skills in painting and drawing.

After completing his studies, Free moved to New York City to further his artistic career. He worked as a freelance artist, taking on various commissions and projects to make a living. In the late 1920s, Free became involved with the Whitney Museum of American Art, where he would eventually work as an assistant curator.

#Whitney Museum assistant curator

In 1929, Free was appointed as an assistant curator at the Whitney Museum of American Art. During his time at the museum, Free was responsible for organizing exhibitions, acquiring new works, and assisting with the daily operations of the institution. He worked closely with the museum's founder, Gertrude Vanderbilt Whitney, to promote American art and provide opportunities for emerging artists.

article:
Roswell Incident

The Roswell incident is one of the most enduring and intriguing UFO stories of all time, and has become a cultural phenomenon. In July 1947, a strange object crashed on a ranch near Roswell, New Mexico, sparking a flurry of rumors and speculation about the nature of the object and the government's involvement. Over the years, the incident has evolved into a complex and multifaceted story, with various theories, hoaxes, and explanations emerging. This article provides an overview of the events surrounding the Roswell incident, as well as the various interpretations and theories that have arisen.

# 1947 military balloon crash

On July 8, 1947, a strange object crashed on a ranch near Roswell, New Mexico. The object was initially described as a "flying disc" by the local military authorities, but was later identified as a top-secret military balloon. The balloon was part of a project called "Project Mogul," which was designed to detect Soviet nuclear tests. The crash was reported by a local rancher, W.W. Brazel, who discovered the debris on his property. Brazel reported that the debris included metallic materials, plastic materials, and other unusual items.

## UFO conspiracy theories (1947–1978)

In the years following the crash, rumors and speculation began to circulate about the nature of the object and the government's involvement. Many people believed that the object was a UFO, and that the government was covering up the truth. These theories were fueled by reports of strange lights and objects in the sky, as well as alleged sightings of alien bodies.

### Aztec crashed saucer hoax

In 1948, a man named Silas Newton claimed that he had recovered a crashed saucer from a site near Aztec, New Mexico. Newton's story, which included descriptions of alien bodies and technology, was widely publicized and helped to fuel the growing UFO craze. However, Newton's story was later revealed to be a hoax.

### Hangar 18

Another popular conspiracy theory surrounding the Roswell incident is the idea of "Hangar 18," a supposed secret facility where the government allegedly stored recovered UFOs and alien bodies. This theory, which has been perpetuated by various books and films, claims that the government has been actively covering up the truth about UFOs and extraterrestrial life.

# Roswell conspiracy theories (1978–1994)

In the late 1970s and early 1980s, a new wave of UFO enthusiasm swept the country, and the Roswell incident became a central part of the UFO mythology.

## The Roswell Incident

In 1980, a book titled "The Roswell Incident" was published, which helped to revive interest in the story. The book, written by Charles Berlitz and William L. Moore, presented a detailed account of the incident and helped to popularize many of the conspiracy theories surrounding it.

## Majestic 12 hoax

In 1980, a man named Jaime Shandera claimed to have discovered a secret government document called "Majestic 12," which allegedly revealed the government's involvement in the Roswell incident. However, the document was later revealed to be a hoax.

## Role of Glenn Dennis

Glenn Dennis, a former mortician, claimed to have been involved in the recovery of alien bodies from the Roswell crash. Dennis's story, which included descriptions of the bodies and the government's alleged cover-up, was widely publicized and helped to fuel the conspiracy theories surrounding the incident.

## Competing accounts and schism

As the years passed, various competing accounts of the Roswell incident emerged, leading to a schism within the UFO community. Some researchers, such as Stanton Friedman, argued that the incident was a genuine UFO event, while others, such as Karl Pflock, argued that the incident was a misidentification of a military balloon.

### UFO Crash at Roswell

In 1991, a book titled "UFO Crash at Roswell" was published, which presented a detailed account of the incident and argued that the government had recovered a UFO.

### Crash at Corona

In 1992, a book titled "Crash at Corona" was published, which presented a competing account of the incident and argued that the crash had occurred at a site near Corona, New Mexico, rather than Roswell.

### The Truth About the UFO Crash at Roswell

In 1994, a book titled "The Truth About the UFO Crash at Roswell" was published, which presented a detailed account of the incident and argued that the government had recovered a UFO.

# Air Force response

In response to the growing controversy surrounding the Roswell incident, the US Air Force launched a number of investigations and issued several reports. In 1994, the Air Force released a report titled "The Roswell Report," which concluded that the incident was a misidentification of a military balloon. In 1997, the Air Force released a second report, which concluded that the incident was likely a combination of a misidentification of a balloon and a hoax.

# Later theories and hoaxes (1994–present)

In the years following the Air Force's reports, a number of new theories and hoaxes emerged.

## Alien Autopsy

In 1995, a film titled "Alien Autopsy" was released, which claimed to show footage of an alien autopsy from the Roswell incident. However, the film was later revealed to be a hoax.

## The Day After Roswell

In 1997, a book titled "The Day After Roswell" was published, which presented a detailed account of the incident and argued that the government had recovered a UFO.

## Related debunked or fringe theories

A number of other debunked or fringe theories have emerged in recent years, including claims of alien technology and reverse-engineered UFOs.

# Explanations

A number of explanations have been proposed for the Roswell incident, including:

## Project Mogul

The most widely accepted explanation is that the incident was a misidentification of a military balloon, part of a project called "Project Mogul."

## Anthropomorphic dummies

Another explanation is that the incident was a misidentification of anthropomorphic dummies, which were used in military experiments.

## Roswell as modern myth and folklore

The Roswell incident has also been interpreted as a modern myth and folklore, reflecting the cultural and societal anxieties of the time.

# Cultural impact

The Roswell incident has had a significant cultural impact, inspiring numerous books, films, and television shows.

## Tourism and commercialization

The incident has also led to a thriving tourism industry, with numerous UFO-themed attractions and businesses emerging in the area.

## Popular fiction

The Roswell incident has been featured in numerous works of popular fiction, including films, television shows, and books.

## Statements by US Presidents

Sanremo Music Festival 2022

The Sanremo Music Festival 2022 was the 72nd edition of the Sanremo Music Festival, the most popular Italian song contest and awards ceremony, held at the Teatro Ariston in Sanremo, Liguria, Italy, between 1 and 5 February 2022. The event was broadcast on Rai 1, Rai Radio 2, and RaiPlay.

# Format

The format of the Sanremo Music Festival 2022 was similar to the previous editions. The competition consisted of two main categories: Big Artists (Artisti in gara) and Sanremo Giovani (Newcomers). The winner of the Big Artists category would represent Italy in the Eurovision Song Contest 2022.

## Presenters

article:
Bigg Boss (Tamil TV series) season 7

Bigg Boss Tamil season 7, also known as Bigg Boss Tamil 7, is the seventh season of the Tamil-language version of the Indian reality television series Bigg Boss. The show is produced by Endemol Shine India and Star Vijay, and premiered on 1 October 2023.

# Production

## Eye logo

The eye logo for Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was revealed on 10 September 2023, featuring a futuristic design with a metallic finish. The logo was designed to represent the theme of the season, which focused on a high-tech and modern setup.

## House themes

### Luxury house

The luxury house for Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was designed to resemble a high-end resort, complete with modern amenities and luxurious furnishings. The house featured a large living area, a fully equipped kitchen, and several bedrooms with attached bathrooms.

### Small house

The small house, also known as the "Chinna Boss" house, was introduced as a new concept in Bigg Boss Tamil season 7. The small house was designed to be a more basic and Spartan setup, with limited amenities and furnishings. The small house was intended to serve as a contrast to the luxury house, and to test the contestants' ability to adapt to different living conditions.

## Concept

The concept for Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was centered around the theme of "high-tech vs. low-tech." The show featured a mix of contestants from different backgrounds and age groups, who were brought together to live in the luxury and small houses. The contestants were tasked with completing various challenges and tasks, while also navigating the complexities of living together in a shared space.

## Teaser

The teaser for Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was released on 15 September 2023, featuring a montage of clips showcasing the contestants and the house. The teaser was set to a catchy and upbeat soundtrack, and generated significant buzz and excitement among fans.

## Voting process

The voting process for Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was similar to previous seasons, with viewers able to vote for their favorite contestants through a mobile app or by sending SMS messages. The contestant with the fewest votes was eliminated each week, unless there was a twist or a special exemption.

article:
Stephen "tWitch" Boss
=====================

Stephen Laurel "tWitch" Boss was an American dancer, choreographer, actor, and television personality. He was best known for his appearances on the reality television show "So You Think You Can Dance" and as a DJ on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show".

Early Life
-----------

Boss was born on September 29, 1982, in Montgomery, Alabama. He grew up in a family of modest means and was raised by his mother, Connie Boss, a teacher. Boss began dancing at a young age and attended the prestigious Alabama School of Fine Arts in Birmingham, where he studied dance.

After high school, Boss moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in dance. He began working as a background dancer for various artists, including Madonna and Beyoncé.

Career
--------

### So You Think You Can Dance

In 2008, Boss auditioned for the fourth season of the reality television show "So You Think You Can Dance". He made it to the top 20 contestants and eventually finished in second place, behind winner Joshua Allen.

Boss's appearance on the show helped launch his career, and he went on to work as a choreographer and dancer on various television shows and films. He also became a regular judge on "So You Think You Can Dance", appearing on the show's seventh, eighth, and ninth seasons.

### Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings

In 2017, Boss joined the Disney+ series "Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings" as a host and executive producer. The show, which premiered in 2018, features couples getting married in Disney-themed weddings.

Personal Life
-------------

Boss married Allison Holker, a fellow dancer and choreographer, in 2013. The couple had three children together: Weslie Renae Boss, born in 2008, and Maddox Laurel Boss and Zaia Boss, born in 2016 and 2019, respectively.

Death
------

Boss died by suicide on December 13, 2022, at the age of 40. His death was met with an outpouring of tributes from the dance and entertainment communities.

Filmography
------------

### Film

* "Stomp the Yard" (2007)
* "Hairspray" (2007)

* "Step Up 3D" (2010)
* "Alvin and the Chipmunks: Chipwrecked" (2011)
